6/14/24 15:07: 20.5 email from GP - Good morning Claire Johnson    dob 03/08/1973 19 Amberden  Basildon  Essex  SS15 5DY NHS:  432 108 5896 I am writing to you aware that your lists are closed to new referrals.  However   I have a lady I am concerned about and I would urge you to consider accepting her based on grounds of need and benefits to her health. She is currently morbidly obese  with bone on bone OA affecting her knees on significant amount of opiates oramorph  pregabalin and other painkillers. She has a history of obesity and her BMI is currently 52. She was referred to the bariatric surgeons having been through Morelife in the past  but did not undergo surgery due to risks. Last year she underwent open heart surgery. She supports her son who has Autism. She is in a catch of being unable to get around due to pain and obesity and has subsequent health consequences and risks. I would be grateful if you might kindly have a meeting to consider accepting this lady for purpose of slimming injections  to enable to her to lose enough weight to be able to undergo her knee surgery to get her life back on track. If you require a referral form I am happy to provide that . Many thanks  Kind Regards   Dr R Teatino   Langdon Hills Medical Centre 01268 418200  REPLY - Dear Colleague Thank you for your email.  We can confirm that you patient is now on the waiting list for one of our weight management programmes and that we will screen her for eligibility for weight loss medication when she starts the programme. Best wishes

8/9/24 8:05: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

responses.question: Comments for any known side effect or relevant information for transfer to new provider
responses.answer: note - client has ulcerative colitis notes from ML consultation dated feb 2025  She explained that bowel symptoms increased once she moved to 1.7mg Wegovy. Excess burping, constipation for up to 7 days and nausea and vomiting. I discussed my concerns re symptoms. She has not tolerated the HIGHER titration. She says she has lost 4 stone and wishes to continue. I have explained that I would recommend No higher than 1mg dose if tolerated and if we restart, she should start the titration again to ensure the side effects are manageable. She needs to drink clear fluids regularly and I would advice a dietician appointment and review of food choices prior to increasing to 0.5mg Summary: restart Wegovy. 0.25mg prescribed. Not to titrate above 1mg If she doe snot open her bowels for > 4 days ahe needs to think about laxatives and if she develops abdominal pain she must stop wegovy and seek urgent medical advice. We will try another titration but if unsuccessful, Wegovy must be stopped.

She needs to drink clear fluids regularly and I would advice a dietician appointment and review of food choices prior to increasing to 0.5mg Summary: restart Wegovy. 0.25mg prescribed. Not to titrate above 1mg If she doe snot open her bowels for > 4 days ahe needs to think about laxatives and if she develops abdominal pain she must stop wegovy and seek urgent medical advice. 3/30/23 0:00: Saxenda Letter of Interest emailed to client. 30/03/2023 Dear Sidney We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

Chalvedon Community Centre  1 Chalvedon Avenue  Basildon SS13 3QX -map attached The Morelife programme is a specialised weight loss service with limited places available and therefore we do highlight the importance of attending the sessions and your commitment to the programme. 3/30/23 0:00: Saxenda- Letter of Interest emailed to client. 30/03/2023 Dear Francesca We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

9/18/23 16:54: Engagement Questionnaire: Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Angjelina Peraj Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? No Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? GP referral Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? Health reasons Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Q6. Were you successful? No Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Other (please specify): Being in pain daily Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines Weighloss Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? Lipodema Etc Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? No Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? N/A Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? No Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? No Response Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery No Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Q18. I am aware that COVID-19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID-19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID-19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a pre-existent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat Yes Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes
9/20/23 10:57: Angjelina's daughter hung back at the end of session 1 today and Angjelina gave consent for me to talk to her. She asked when I would be doing her engagement call as she wanted to speak to me and we agreed to conduct the call then and there. She said that her mum suffers from Lipodema and this makes things very difficult. She reported that Lipodema doesn't respond to weight management techniques  but did say her mum did need to lose weight. She was concerned that our advice wouldn't be applicable to her mum. Her GP wants her to start injections as he believes that this will help with the Lipodema. My advice was to stay on with us as the weight loss injections are likely to be prescribed through ourselves. she was concerned they were wasting our time. I said  not at all. Healthy eating and physical activity is beneficial for anyone  and many of the things we talk about may help her to keep up the healthy diet she says they are currently following. They will let me know how they get on.

responses.question: Comments for any known side effect or relevant information for transfer to new provider
responses.answer: Having side effects diarrhoea, heart burn, bloating � had bad past week. Still wishes to continue using 2.4mg as she siad she had side effect since starting Wegovy and is not dose dependent. They feel it is really helping with weight loss and they are aware to seek medical attention (NHS GP/ 111/ A&E) for serious & worsening side effects.

7/4/24 15:38: Wegovy email to GP - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

responses.question: Additonal comments
responses.answer:
Date and time: 31/03/2025 at 15:30. Incident during psychology coaching session 3, phone call. Chelsea explained that approximately two weeks prior, she experienced hearing voices of a "man", which was external to her own thoughts and voice. She reported this led to a "breakdown", in regards to her mental health and severe anxiety. She had thoughts that she would die and that her son would die. She reported a thought that, "maybe it would be easier if I ended it", and said this was in response to reducing her anxiety. She also reported experiencing intrusive images when in the community, of people being hit by cars, but she understood that these events did not take place. She explained that she has since been reviewed by her GP regarding this. She was referred by her GP to ARMS, a psychosis mental health service. She said this referral was rejected. She said she has the contact details of a crisis mental health team. Signposting and a safety plan was completed. Chelsea said she is not longer feeling in crisis with her mental health. She said she continues to feel anxious and that she may die before her son is 20 years old, as the voice she experienced said. However, she said this is manageable and said she felt this was "silly", in terms of the voice and images she experienced.

 MDT outcome 
patient discussed at MDT due to recent SG concerns
Deemed as no immediate risk and unlikely causation for MH deterioration
also noted approaching weight check point and not yet achieved it.

In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

9/15/22 0:00: Saxenda letter of interest sent by email to seek consent to contact with GP for updated blood investigation to check eligibility. Noted that client preferred method of contact is sms- emily notified for same. 15/09/22 Dear Fozia We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

12/28/23 11:19: MLP/conf email sent - Good Morning It was a pleasure speaking with you. I just wanted to confirm that you have been booked onto our 1pm virtual group starting on Wednesday 10th January. Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy. 12/28/23 11:19: MLP/conf email sent - Good Morning It was a pleasure speaking with you. I just wanted to confirm that you have been booked onto our 1pm virtual group starting on Wednesday 10th January. Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

Not eligible for Saxenda letter emailed to client. 04/04/2023 Dear Emma We are contacting you to inform you that More Life has now completed the internal screening process to find out if you are eligible for a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) which is now available to clients living in the South Essex area that meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria set be NICE guidance below unfortunately we can confirm that you do not meet all the criteria which means you are not eligible for this drug. • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia However you shall be able to join our 12 month More Life programme and receive support from our qualified weight management practitioners to achieve your goal. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

7/8/24 11:39: Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy. 9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

2/18/25 16:35: Good morning  I have attended the face to face meetings with Sinead and am now on Wegovy.  I have attended the monthly meetings on Zoom but I am not getting anything from them.  They are only going over the same things that were presented at the face to face meetings and the Zoom meetings are held with other groups members who are strangers to me. I am not happy discussing my problems of taking Wegovy with the group on line as I don't know them and to go into details of having excess wind  sickness and diarrohea with a group of strangers is not what I feel comfortable with. Following the face to face meetings we were told of the Zoom meeting plan but a few of us agreed that this was not what we wanted and we arranged to meet up as usual on a Tuesday to weigh and discuss our progress.  Since then a group of between 3 and 5 of us have met every Tuesday at my house.  We weigh  have a cup of coffee and discuss our week and any problems that have arisen.  We have all agreed that the Zoom meetings are not for us and we get nothing from them.  We get more from our once a week meeting with each other. I have emailed Sinead pointing out the problems that I have with Zoom and asking her if she would like to have any input to our once a week meetings and asking her for any incentive for me to continue with the Zoom meetings.  I have not had any reply but I have received a reminder of the next Zoom meeting. I understand that my attendance at the Zoom meetings is contractual with continuing with the Wegovy programme but I am seriously wondering why I have to go over and over the same things  that I am not comfortable discussing my problems with strangers and I get more from the face to face meetings at my house. Please can you assure me that if I drop out of the Zoom meetings I will still be considered to be on the programme or give me a reason why I should consider continuing with these meetings. Thank you. Regards  Barbara Taylor 
2/18/25 17:02: Response to client: Hi Barbara   I hope you are well. Thank you for getting in touch with us.  I am writing to you to respond to the email you sent to our Wegovy inbox today 18/02/2025.  I am sorry to hear that you are not enjoying the monthly sessions  I understand the transition from face-to-face to online can be challenging and provide a different experience. I do appreciate the feedback you’ve provided  the monthly sessions can be recapping a lot of the same information from the weekly stage but it serves as a reminder of the content and to re-enforce the information. We have recently made some changes to our curriculum for the monthly stage so you will see some different topics coming up over the next few months. The maintenance stage is really an opportunity for additional support while you put into practice the guidance shared during the weekly stage.  Please don’t feel like you have to share anything that you don’t feel comfortable with the group. All contributions you make are entirely up to you. We would discourage discussing your Wegovy prescription and side effects with the group as the practitioner facilitating the group is not part of the Wegovy pathway so not the best person to support you with any queries/problems. It would be better discussed in your appointments with the Wegovy team. There will also be a large number of clients in the group who are not receiving the Wegovy medication.  It is great that your previous group still meets regularly in person and that you’re finding those meet ups helpful  we would only encourage anything that supports you with your weight management. However we wouldn’t be able to be involved directly with activities that occur outside of our programme.  NICE guidelines state that clients who are prescribed Wegovy have to be actively participating in a Tier 3 weight management programme in order to access Wegovy medication https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/ta875/chapter/1-Recommendations. The rationale for this is that results from clinical trials show people lose more weight with semaglutide alongside supervised weight management support than with the support alone. The Mid and South Essex ICB have set an attendance criteria of 6 out of 8 monthly sessions in order to qualify for the medication. Unfortunately if you drop out of our weight management programme your place on the Wegovy pathway would be affected.  If you’d like me to call you to discuss the above information I am happy to do that.  Please let me know if you have any further questions.  Thanks   Orla McMahon

Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

Best wishes Alison 
3/7/24 14:11: Client emailed me and left a voicemail: Dear Sarah   Thank-you for your email this morning advising the new schedule of session leads. I have left you a voicemail and requested a callback to discuss however  as I am really very disappointed that we are going to have three different people leading the remaining five sessions. From brief conversation with several other participants I am not alone in this disappointment. I will speak for myself and only reference them in a general way as I have not discussed with them whether to speak on their behalf  but please know that my sentiments are reflected by other members of the group. On being invited to participate in this group I was anxious as to who would be running it; like many people who have been very overweight for a long time I have experienced being patronised  judged and insulted by people including health professionals and I am now mistrustful of speaking about my weight even with those who are supposed to help. When Darragh emailed us to introduce himself I googled him to understand who we would be running the group such was the anxiety  and honestly my participation hinged to a great degree on trusting who was leading it. I was reassured to a great extent by his introductory phone call  and as the weeks went on it was clear that he was a supportive  non-judgemental figure. Because of this he has had great success in encouraging me  and other group members  to engage in the programme and in the discussions with the honesty and openness that we are asked for as part of our participation in order to achieve the results that we all hope to. It is an unwritten but critical element of the contract between yourselves as an organisation and group members.  Now we are being asked to continue to participate with openness and honesty guided by three different people that we don't know  that we have no trusting relationship with  and for the part of the course that will be addressing the cognitive aspects of weight management which for some people  including myself  may bring up uncomfortable memories  thoughts and feelings. I would suggest that most of the people taking part in the group will have been very overweight for a very long time  and if learning about calorie counting was all that we needed to lose weight then we would all have been a healthy weight years ago. Most of us will have tried it  and most of us are actually benefitting from an ongoing relationship with a lead that gives support and provides the opportunity for weekly accountability - to an individual  not a link to a form. Most of us will really need this next part of the course to be delivered well in order to create and entrench behaviour change. I appreciate that people may leave jobs and we all very much wished Darragh the best on his departure  but is already unsettling to have to navigate the change from one lead to another and to be switching between three people in five weeks seems truly inappropriate.  As well as issues around a lack of trusting relationship it feels  to borrow a phrase from another group member  as though this is a tick box exercise by MoreLife to get the course completed. Like others I am concerned about the sense of continuity between sessions  and who we can reach out to for additional support between sessions if we need it. I would also note that there are group members who have identified themselves as being neurodivergent and there may well be additional impact on some of those members with these constant changes. None of this has been addressed or acknowledged in your email to us this morning  not even an apology for the disruption caused or an invitation to contact someone with any questions.    I anticipate that you will respond to me telling me that it is unfortunate but unavoidable  that there are issues with staffing levels and availability  and likely some kind of reassurance that all of your colleagues are caring and well trained and all able to deliver the programme. Unfortunately though corporate reassurances cannot replace relationships. It matters who runs the sessions  human connection matters. I hope that you will reconsider the scheduling for staffing the remainder of the course. I assume that I am not the only person who has waited over a year for this opportunity  having needed it for many more years before it was even offered  only to be deeply disappointed with this plan for delivery. I look forward to hearing from you. With regards Alison 
3/7/24 14:12: emailed client back: Hello Alison  I’m so sorry that it’s taken so long to get back to you. I spoke to Emily yesterday afternoon and she mentioned to me that you had concerns around consistency of practitioners. She’s currently looking into options to address your concerns. In the meantime I think a phonecall would be best to talk about your worries and concerns. Would you be free for a call tomorrow at all? On Fridays I work 8am-4pm. I could be free to talk at any point in that window. If that doesn’t work for you  I’m sure we can come up with an alternative time.

I'm really sorry I haven't been able to get hold of you until now and I'm sorry that I couldn't respond as quickly as I'd have liked you. There is another practitioner down to deliver your group from another area next week  that’s Matthew. We're looking into seeing if he could cover the rest of your sessions. 8/1/24 8:42: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

8/23/24 14:50: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

7/26/24 8:11: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

9/8/23 14:01: Engagement Questionnaire Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Charles K ballanger Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? Yes Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? Health Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? I've never wanted to be this big but life now days does not help with health and mental distress of being this big really hard to cope with Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Weight Loss Medication Reducing Portion Monitoring calories Reducing carbohydrates Q6. Were you successful? Yes Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Change in circumstances Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines I just want my life back and not have have all this brain fog and health issues Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? Breathing Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? Yes Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? Yes Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? Yes Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? No libido Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery No Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Q18. I am aware that COVID19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a preexistent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat Yes Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes
9/8/23 14:11: engagement call completed. discussed mental health. Charles is just generally unhappy being the size he is. looking forward to starting on the programme.
9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

I’m very sorry to have to postpone your session. However  we will add an extra session to the end of your programme. You will still get all 12 sessions. Take care everyone and I’ll see you for your next session on 2nd October  Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

1/17/24 10:47: MLP/Conf email sent - Good Morning Welcome to MoreLife the Weight Management Service. Your group starts on Tuesday 23rd January at 6pm. The duration of the group is 1 hour and 30 mins and runs every Tuesday for 12 weeks. Please find the address of the venue below. Chalvedon Community Centre  1 Chalvedon Avenue  Basildon SS13 3QX -map attached The Morelife programme is a specialised weight loss service with limited places available and therefore we do highlight the importance of attending the sessions and your commitment to the programme. If for any reason you are unable to attend a session please do make our staff aware of this as soon as possible  or if you feel that this is not the right time to start your journey please do let us know so that we can offer your place to someone else. Your weight management practitioner is Sarah and she will be in contact to welcome you and answer any final questions you may have. Please note that this is the first phase of your programme and there will be 8 monthly sessions after. Sarah will give you more information about this nearer the time. Alongside your weekly sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the face to face sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. Finally  myself and the team at MoreLife would like to wish you the all the best on your weight loss journey.    Best Wishes

As part of our assessment process we ask all clients to complete a series of psychological questionnaires – including GAD-7/PHQ-9. We have received the following response from your patient that may indicate significant anxiety/depression: Total score from PHQ-9: 16 Answer from question 9 of PHQ-9: Not at all [x] Several days [] More than half the days [] Nearly every day [] Note - above 0 on question 9 of PHQ-9 may indicate a risk of suicidal ideation or self-harm. 11/4/22 0:00: First binge eating session completed. We discussed reasons- stemmed from childhood was a bigger child and mum made her yoyo diet. At the start mentioned her husband is quite worried and concerned about her health. Has always yoyo dieted and will really restrict her eating to a few hundred calories to then binge eating and eating everything. Is very aware her eating behaviors are emotional eating and using food as a comfort. During covid had a very significant breakdown and her job is very stressful and highlight how relevant the hot cross bun section was. Behaviors has loss of sex drive broken sleep and over sleeps. Pain is a trigger- aware she is overweight and needs to do something about it but feels shame judgment low self worth. Feel anxious stressed worried. Sensations sweaty palms racing heart. Areas which she would like to increase- Walking with the dogs. Enjoying being out in public Be able to spend quality time with her husband ie enjoy going out for dinner. More fun and enjoyable activities. Enjoy more of life. Wants to reduce the way she feels about herself. Negative thoughts. To stop yoyo dieting restrictive eating and binge eating. Wants to reduce how reliant she is on food. Angela was quite emotional throughout the sessions but was very open with me.

Is still spreading her food intake out and eating more during the day and is having less cravings because of this. Is feelings physically better and feeling less tired and drained. Has started to weigh herself again and we discussed where the restriction and negative thoughts can become more of a focus from this. We discussed different way this can be prevented and how she can control this. For example asking her husband to hide the scales choosing which days she will weigh and if she can keep monitoring her feelings emotions and mental wellbeing too. We discussed her long and short term goals and how she can keep incorporating this into her life and keep her focused. Has started a new hobby which is helping her mentally. Weight hasn't drastically changed and is now 26 1/2 Stone.

We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. 7/5/24 13:19: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. 6/21/23 0:00: Email from GP - Our ref: JW.IS.438 059 9434 Your ref: D1118826 (Bas Hosp) Friday 2nd June 2023 Morelife Team Dear colleague Ms Donna Grant - 11 Apr 1971 3 Paxfords Laindon Basildon Essex SS15 6SG (Home) or (Mobile) 07955 699101 In terms of eligibility criteria with regards to saxenda your form says about the last 12 months for a HbA1C value. I have a patient who in 2018 had a fasting glucose of 5.8 but on repeat in 2023 it is 5.3. Does the fasting glucose value have to be within the range specified on your form in the last year as well or is it if it has ever been in that range? Many thanks for your clarification. Yours sincerely Dictated but not signed Dr James Watson REPLY - Dear Doctor The blood test results - fasting glucose and HbA1c both need to be within last 12 months. Any of the above test results within last 1 year that indicates non-diabetic hyperglycaemia can be considered for Saxenda eligibility alongside CVD risk factors as high blood pressure or dyslipidaemia. Regards

1/24/25 10:25: RB called client in response to their email dated 23/01/2025 ( called twice on 23/01/2025 and rearranged call for today morning) about restarting wegovy as missed dose on Tuesday 21/01/2025 due to hospital admission overnight.                                            They started wegovy on 14/1/2025 0.25mg weekly dose. And they stated on 20/01/2025 they had vomiting and diarrhea- 3 episodes of vomiting and diarrhea that continued into next day 21/01/2025 and they were very dizzy.  They also reported  starting on doxazosin on 8/1/2025and was warned about nausea & sickness as side effect. Thus Called GP on 21/01/2025  as to report on alphablockers and she was asked to report  BP 136/72  pulse rate 115 over phone   also reported feeling weak  dizziness  Vomiting/ diarrhea as she realized she had been taking double dose of statin in error 80mg instead of 40mg) - GP asked them to visit clinic  next morning( 22/01/2025) and was concerned on their  pulse rate and was advised to go to Hospital .                                                          Client confirmed they informed GP about wegovy (RB noted GP letter on starting wegovy is also sent out to GP by MoreLife) and  GP was not concerned about continuing wegovy. She visited Hospital and was treated for dehydration and reported below  to  MoreLife                                                                              '' Hi I had an overnight hospital stay (Tuesday) due to gastroenteritis/ dehydration - I was intravenously given fluid  anti sickness and anti biotic  once blood tests confirmed by kidney function was back to normal I was discharged late yesterday afternoon I'm sure it's fine but is it ok to take wegovy injection today? (2 days late) I'm passing urine  have had normal stools and eaten a small dinner  breakfast and lunch'' Client confirmed that she is now feeling well in herself and has no diarrhea and vomitting  bowel are normal and she is eating food and wishes to resume WEgovy. When asked if you reported at Hospital you are on wegovy - siad yes and said that they had no concerns. I am requesting admin to write to their NHS GP for upto date PCS including discharge note from Hospital and shall share with Dr Herring &Zeenah. May I please ask what is your advice for this case.

We request you to please provide an up-to-date medical history  including medication list  recent attendance to GP surgery and copy of discharge notes from Hospital. Action: Request you to please send following information (up to date medical history  including medication list  recent attendance to GP surgery and copy of discharge notes from Hospital) urgently to wegovy@more-life.co.uk. Kind regards

I would advice a FU appointment prior to increasing he next dose to ensure she is tolerating it.

In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

7/3/24 10:20: Wegovy Letter sent -Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE

12/13/22 0:00: Had session 1 of BED intervention with client today. He talked about being there for everyone else but that he didn't have the same back. He works as a nurse and does night shifts and feels he hasn't got a good balance as he works a lot. He feels this has contributed to his eating. He reports that when things are going well he will get a takeaway as a reward. He reports feeling disheartened and angry at himself for putting on so much weight after loosing weight in the past. I discussed with him whether he felt this was a good time to do the programme as he had said he found it hard to accept that the programme wasn't about weight loss However he did acknowledge he knows his problems are psychological and that it would take time and he would like to continue. I asked him whether he had any support at work for his stress he said that they signposted him to his GP to see a therapist. He reported that he didn't feel comfortable seeing a therapist as it would bring up past issues he wasn't comfortable with recalling. He said he would feel better in therapy if he didn't live on his own. I informed him that some of the stuff in the sessions could potentially trigger some feelings and that if he didn't feel comfortable to let me know and we could reassess whether it is the right time to do the programme.

1/27/23 0:00: BB Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Mental Health Support – Vita Minds IAPT Basildon Brentwood Billericay & Wickford - Vita (vitahealthgroup.co.uk) Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. 7/3/24 10:20: Wegovy Letter sent -Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE

If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

1/27/23 0:00: BB Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes
