5/5/23 0:00: Saxenda - letter of interest emailed to client 05/05/2023 Dear Ligia We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

1/30/24 15:20: Hi Darragh   Thank you very much for calculating this calories for me.  So in order to loose weight I should be somewhere between 1200 and 1521 calories/ day  right?  I am thinking to try calories counting as I've never done it before and I know I have to do bigger changes to get better results. I wil do this as main choice but will also work on eating mindfully and whenever I can't scan the barcodes I will apply portion control. Sounds interesting the hand measuring. Is this a good plan? What do you think?  I've started to use the My fitness pall app and to scan the barcode of what I eat. I feel I need time to get used to it. Another thing is that now I have to take the phone with me to the kitchen to scan the barcodes ?. I started to work on being more mindful while eating and  I left my phone in my bedroom when going in the kitchen to eat. But will scan the barcodes and I'll be a good girl ??Will put it aside while eating to give this time to myself just for eating.  There are lot of things I need to work on and to change. I don't realy have a routine  I don't have those 3 main meals/day with snacks in between. My sleeping is also all over the place  being in lot of pain and very exhausted and short of breath many times I am glad  I can get some sleep when I can that being day or night. My eating times are also orchestrated by this issues. I use to sleep till 12 -1 pm so I don't really have breakfast time.  Another thing is that I can't exercise as I would like to. I have from phisyo bed and sitting exercises. I know compared to times when I couldn't exercise at all it is something but I would like to be able to do much more. Hopefully in time I'll get there. Another problem I have is with nutrition as many times I am thinking what to eat. I know my liver enzymes are  a bit elevated and I am on pretty much medication (opioids for pain management) but it looks like whatever I eat I don't feel well after eating; very bloted  like pumped up  can't breath  can't find a comfortable position in bed somehow  more exhausted and sleepy and I put on about 2-3 kg after a normal meal (like water retention ??? or I don't know what is it ???). Honestly I feel better if I don't eat but I need to live with something  I need to eat something. Because I can't cook I buy ready meals and warm it in micro (which isn't really healty). I found small portions (I never eat to be  full) of milk and porridge or wetabix  seeded wholemeal toast bread and boiled fresh meat being ok to have  that won't make me feel so very bad after eating. Still bloated but not that realy bad like after a cooked meal. Does other people with long covid have this issue feeling worse after eating and do you know what is the cause of it? Could you please help me about this issues? I really don't know what to eat ???   I am trying to have fruits (not sweet ones) and I am thinking about juicing as I really don't know what to do and how to sort out this issue with eating and feeling worse after it. But not sure with juicing if I'll have enough energy   if I'll be well enough to be consistent with doing it and I need to learn how to combine them  how to do it. I've not done it before.Maybe when I can I do it when not  not ?. Also what do I do about proteins with juicing? What do you think about it?  I know when I am in a flare up I am in very much pain and very exhausted so for few days I only drink fluids like water  sips of milk  milky decaff coffee  sips of orange juice maybe  and slep sleep sleep as even eating and digestion is too much effort to do.  From your experience have you met people with such issues before and what would help? I heard you speaking with the others during last session about curry rice  pasta  lasagne  and I was just thinking when was the last time I aet such things? To me such things are like poison not food and I don't understand why. I know my liver enzymes are little elevated but GP said that's ok  nothing to worry or to do about it. I also had bloods done and it's not autoimune disease. Thank you for allowing us to have the video off sometimes during our zoom sessions. I find it hard to sit on the chair at my desk for 1hour 30 minutes and I get pretty exhausted and in pain so sometimes I have to come to bed to lay down. Also because of brain fog issues I find it hard sometimes to concentrate for long periods of time  it gives me headache and I can't remember words that's why I don't really speak much and I preffer using the chat to answer your questions. But I am trying my best to learn as much as I can and to work actively on loosing weight.  The respiratory consultant advised I need bariatric surgery and sent a letter to my GP about it but I don't consider it best option and I would avoid it; what you cut out cut out remains for ever  you can't put it back after.  I've also been contacted from More Life about screening for Saxenda injections and GP done the bloods and sent over the results. I was told I qualify for it but last time I phoned to ask if I could speak with a Dr about it I was told I should first start the online sessions and during the program I should speak with my coach about it. Of course I want to learn lifestyle changes and a healthy way of eating as for long term I think this is the best option but I am also opened to other options (surgery being last one on the list) if that's what I need and what would help me.  I am sharing this with you so you can get to know me better and the issues I am dealing with and also because I know I need help regarding this stubborn morbid obesity I've got to somehow come out of it as I don't want to get complications and more health issues from it.  As a note I want to let you know when we started the program and I sent you my first weight values I was on my period and I ussualy gain weight with it. So last week  the second values I sent was about 1.5 kg less but as you know that wasn't actually fat loss (I wish it would be ?????) but probably water retention loss related to being after my period. Just feel I need to share this with you as you probably wondered what have I done that works so well... 1 5 kg lost in one week. ???  Thank you very much for everything you do to help us  for being there for us. Your efforts  help and support are much appreciated!  Kind regards   Ligia.

3/1/23 0:00: T'ROCK Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Thurrock Healthy Lifestyle Service - Thurrock Healthy Lifestyle Service | Public Health | Thurrock Council ? Mental Health Support – Thurrock Inclusion IAPT Service Home - Inclusion Thurrock Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. " We apologise for any inconvenience caused. Your health is important to us and that’s why we wanted to update you and offer you the chance to explore other services in the meantime. We look forward to welcoming you to our programme in the near future. Best wishes The MoreLife Team

9/18/23 11:02: Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Adetutu Ajenifuja Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? Yes Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? GP referral Diagnosis of Diabetes Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? I feel it will help with managing the diabetes. Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Reducing Portion Reducing carbohydrates Q6. Were you successful? Yes Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Money Unsustainable programme Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines Support in any way. Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? Diabetes  Hypertension and high cholesterol. Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? Yes Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? Yes Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? No Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? Polycystic ovarian syndrome. Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery No Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. I am aware that COVID-19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID-19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID-19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a pre-existent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat Yes Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes

10/26/23 7:50: To Tutu 26/10/2023 Hello Tutu   You’re more than welcome  I completely understand  unfortunately with the worldwide shortage of saxenda we are unable to prescribe Saxenda on out programme additionally Saxenda has very strict eligibility criteria. So  once supplies resume  you’d still only be able to get Saxenda under NICE guidelines if ALL THREE of the following applied: •	You have a BMI of above 35 •	You have non-diabetic Hyperglycaemia – That is an HbA1c reading of 42-47 or a fasting blood glucose level of 5.5-6.9 without diabetes (pre-diabetic individuals) •	You have another cardiovascular risk factor e.g. High Blood pressure or High Cholesterol. In regards to Wegovey we are aiming to have this medication in our services however we are not certain when this will be available at this current point in time.  However  if you were prescribed this medication on our services  you would need to attend a minimum of 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions and 4 out of the 8 monthly sessions to still be prescribed.  With your journey is there anything that you are particularly struggling with?

7/4/24 15:38: Wegovy email to GP - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

1/27/23 0:00: BB Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Mental Health Support – Vita Minds IAPT Basildon Brentwood Billericay & Wickford - Vita (vitahealthgroup.co.uk) Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. We apologise for any inconvenience caused. Your health is important to us and that’s why we wanted to update you and offer you the chance to explore other services in the meantime. We look forward to welcoming you to our programme in the near future. A member of our team will be in touch in the next few weeks. Best wishes The MoreLife Team

5/5/23 0:00: Saxenda- letter of interest emailed to client 05/05/2023 Dear Sally We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

SWANWOOD PARTNERSHIP. 2 MARKET AVENUE WICKFORD ESSEX SS12 0AG Date: 13/06/2023 Dear Doctor Patient: Sally Anne Brosnan D.O.B: 22/06/1972 Your patient has been referred to us for Adult Weight Management and has expressed an interest in Saxenda (Liraglutide). Saxenda has been evidenced to support individuals lose weight and reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease. In order to check their eligibility we need relevant blood results* dated within the last 12 months and current medication / diagnosis lists. • If this information is available then please send it as a PCS attachment to the above email address. • If they have not had the below tests in the last 12 months please could you arrange this with your patient and send us the results when available. Unfortunately without this information we are unable to assess eligibility and would not be able to prescribe Saxenda. *In particular we need: • HbA1c • Fasting Plasma Glucose • Lipid Profile • Blood pressure • eGFR • Current medication • Current diagnosis list (surgical & medical) Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: 1 Recommendations | Liraglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

2/9/24 13:29: Morning Darragh  Another mixed bag from me this week  I’m afraid. Weight hasn’t moved - still 19st 12lb. But to be fair and totally honest  I haven’t been calorie counting at all. This Covid has really knocked us so with all of us down with it  it’s been a matter of eating when and whatever we could  and keeping it as easy as possible so everyone at least ate. I also just had no energy for cooking separate meals or lots of shopping so just did whatever worked. Not ideal when you should be watching what you eat but I figured  like you said previously  it was one week out of all the weeks and I could improve things when I felt better. I’m glad to say  I think I’m over the worst of it so the next week should be easier  and I’m happy that at least I haven’t gained. Exercise wise  my first goal was to wear my Apple Watch every day and start tracking my ‘rings’ so I had a baseline to improve on. I actually originally bought the watch so it was easier for me to phone for help if the dog had a hypo so I only ever wore it on dog walks. But I’ve worn it all day every day this week and my average is 14 mins exercise  400 calories  14 stand  6185 steps. I’ve found by wearing it  I’ve wanted to close the rings so I’ve improved as the week’s gone on. Today I’ve increased the goals slightly so that next week I’ll do more. I’ve researched some exercise classes in the area  and I’m interested in one  but it’s about finding the time because as you know  I’m responsible for my mum and dog and very limited in free time. When my son is back from uni in June  that will be easier for me. In the meantime  now I’m over the Covid  I plan to try and incorporate some at home exercises so I’ll let you know how that goes next week. Speak later  Sally. 
2/9/24 13:32: 1 to 1 carried out with Sally. Current lifestyle  caring for mother and also her dog  has 2 autistic children in their 20s  she has to do jobs for them like ironing cooking meals and they will have different meals. sally is very educated in regards to nutrition  she doesn't feel she eats poorly she doesn't drink or eat between meals. we discussed some goals for her to implement as this is where she feels she has no motivation because she had nothing in place. 3 goals she came up with was to drink more water  she does not like cold water so going to fill a bottle of room temp. going to try and do a youtube exercise video and also continue to walk her dogs 2x a day. lastly to bulk meals with salad on the ide and reduce overall portions.
2/23/24 14:45: Morning Darragh  Scales flitting between 19st 10lb and 19st 9lb today. It’s been a very busy week so not much to report. I’ve stuck with my promises though and am hitting my new watch targets  doing a session of Joe Wicks weekly  drinking more water and bulking up with salad and vegetables. My foot has held up on medication  although it’s not particularly comfortable so I’ve not introduced strollercise yet or increased my at home sessions. I think I’ll have to do this gradually as I can’t be in a position where I can’t function as those I care for obviously rely on me so it’s a nightmare if I’m out of action. I’ve not started batch cooking but I am consciously not cooking excess food - eg. I’ve reduced the size of the mince I buy from 750g to 500g and/or freezing the extra piece of food in the pack rather than just cooking and eating it anyway. Chat with you later Sally

1/31/23 0:00: BB Client Ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? 7/4/24 9:25: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. 3/29/23 0:00: Saxenda -Letter of Interest emailed to client 29/03/2023 Dear Victoria We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

8/27/24 13:24: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

3/15/25 8:51: Hi Anothony  MoreLife Pharmacist acknowledged you have tried most of the options to manage sulfur burps but feels may be peppermint oil capsules 0.2mg otc  may help. Please note below some of highlighted points- to try.  Also  please contact your NHS GP if symptoms (burps) persist. I shall call you for follow up on 17/18 March 2025 sulfur burps while taking Wegovy (semaglutide)  here are some management strategies to help reduce them: 1. Dietary Adjustments •	Avoid sulfur-rich foods: Limit intake of eggs  garlic  onions  cruciferous vegetables (broccoli  cabbage  cauliflower)  and high-protein animal foods •	Limit carbonated drinks: Sodas and sparkling water can introduce excess gas. •	Reduce sugar substitutes: Sorbitol  mannitol  and xylitol (found in sugar-free gum and diet products) can cause digestive issues. •	Eat slowly & chew thoroughly: This reduces swallowed air and improves digestion- Mindful eating 2. Optimize Gut Health •	Probiotics: Taking probiotics or eating fermented foods (like low fat yogurt or kefir) may help balance gut bacteria and reduce gas production. •	Fiber intake: Gradually increase fiber to prevent constipation  which can worsen sulfur burps. •	Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of water  (1.5-2l/d)  reduce caffeine-try decaffeinated tea 3. Medication Considerations •	Acid reflux treatment: If burps are accompanied by heartburn  talk to your NHS GP about antacids or acid reducers (e.g.  omeprazole or famotidine). 4. Wegovy-Specific Strategies •	Adjust dosing time: If symptoms are worse at a certain time  consider changing when you take Wegovy (we can explore this in our next call). •	Monitor portion sizes: Wegovy slows digestion  so eating smaller meals can reduce bloating and burping. •	Assess for side effects: If symptoms persist or worsen- we shall review dosage – to be discussed in next call Thanking You Regards Dr Ranjana Babber  RD  PhD

7/31/24 9:12: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

9/18/23 11:21: Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Alexandra Foley Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? No Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? GP referral Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? I suffer with PCOS. I have been advised the only way I can get help and support is to loose weight. Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Laxatives Meal Replacement i.e. Slimfast Slimming groups i.e. Weight Watchers  Slimming World Weight Loss Medication Reducing Portion Monitoring calories Reducing carbohydrates Q6. Were you successful? No Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Money Unsustainable programme Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines A change in life style that I can maintain for the long term. Even when the programme finishes Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? PCOS has always made loosing weight hard Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? No Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? Yes Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? No Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? No Response Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery Yes Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Q18. I am aware that COVID-19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID-19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID-19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a pre-existent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat No Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. No

7/8/24 10:17: Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE

7/9/24 9:02: Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE

4/7/24 12:57: Dear Jacqueline Joyner   We are writing to inform you that you have met the eligibility criteria for Wegovy (Semaglutide) at MoreLife.  What to expect?  Wegovy can be prescribed for a maximum of two years. For some of this time period you will be attending sessions at MoreLife  we will also provide you with an online digital programme called ‘My Life Plan’. You will receive support from our specialist team throughout the two years you are prescribed Wegovy. We will mostly contact you on the telephone with an option for a video call via Zoom at month 6. At your appointments we will check things such as: what dose you are taking  if you have any side effects  what you are eating and your current weight. Important Information Discussed during the initial consultation. Highlighted risk: Type 2 diabetes To ensure you can stay on this medication you need to be able to commit to the following: •	Please discontinue gliclazide while taking Wygovy. This will reduce your risk of hypoglycaemia. •	Increase capillary monitoring to 3-4 times a day and if symptomatic. •	We have discussed hypoglycaemia symptoms and your awareness and management. •	Please inform your diabetes team that you have started Wygovy for a maximum of 2 years through a weight management programme. •	Please ensure your HbA1c is checked in 3 months. •	Ensure you attend your annual diabetes screening including yearly retinal screening appointments. Kind Regards  Dr Roselle Herring MoreLife (Ltd) UK

To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

2/13/24 17:15: sent to client - Hi Lynda Thank you for sending this update across. Alcohol can definitely put us over our calories very quickly  out of curiosity what do you tend to drink when you socialise? It can be part of a healthy balanced diet but it has to be in moderation. I tend to advise people to avoid casual drinking at home and to drink once a week ( if you have lots of social events) and aim to stick to non alcoholic drinks the rest of the time. We can also make better decisions when drinking in terms of calories. For example a vodka tonic or gin will be far less calories than a glass of wine. Im afraid I cant advise on specifics when it comes to your carbohydrate intake  this is definitely something you should discuss with either a specialist or your gp - we will talk about carbohydrates this evening but im afraid we don’t go into specifics regarding diabetes. We do have sessions for diabetes info that are run from time to time  if you think this would be helpful I can find out when the next sessions are and send this information across? I will get your calories worked out and sent across asap  and I do like the goals you have set ?. I will see you shortly. Kindest regards

The other difference is lack of alcohol which is both saving me loads of calories and diminishing number of calories consumed as snack foods associated with the alcohol. - I am not confident on how long I will keep up thesis but we will see. 5/7/24 9:44: forwarded to RH and RB for prescription - Hi Claire   I have managed to speak my GP and  without further blood tests  he decided that I am now a type 2 diabetic and because HbA1c level is only 50 mmol no medications are required.   My GP arranged for me to speak to a nurse but because she was unable to say how long it will take for NHS diabetic retinopathy screening results  I contacted the centre that organises this and she said it takes approx. 3 months before test can be done.   I therefore went to my opticians at boots and explained the problem and they very kindly have performed a thorough dilated retinal eye examination. The optician said explained their scanners were more detailed than the NHS screening ones. I am pleased to say that there was no indication retinopathy or maculopathy. See letter attached.   Moreover from the research I have completed the diabetes website (https://www.diabetes.co.uk/diabetes-complications/diabetic-retinopathy.html#google_vignette) and other sites  it says that rapid reduction of HbA1cwhich could make any diabetic retinopathy worse is defined as a drop in HbA1c of 30mmol/mol. I assume such a drop will be extremely unlikely in my case because my HbA1c is only 50.   In view of the above and as I really want to get into type 2 remission as early as possible and shift as much weight as quickly as possible (My gynaecologist has targeted me with a weight of 11 stone) I shall be very grateful if the doctor could reassess my suitability for a Wegovy prescription please.   Attached:    Screenshot of GP decision Letter from Boots opticians   Many thanks   Lynda Robinson 23/6/62

1/10/25 12:08: Wegovy 9 month survey callback- attempted to call client but no answer. Email sent to client with following: Hi Lynda  I hope you are well. In response to your 9 month Wegovy survey you completed  Please find attached resources for Constipation  regarding the side effects you are experiencing: https://www.bda.uk.com/static/60b67254-7eec-4c7a-a38d8b927a9929f0/d3c18e89-043f-4150-ae78e663b73503b7/I-find-it-difficult-to-have-a-poo-constipation.pdf https://www.bda.uk.com/resource/feeling-bunged-up-dont-let-poo-be-a-taboo-constipation.html Please also find attached the updated patient brochure for Wegovy  please read side effects and awareness of warning signs of bowel obstruction and seek NHS GP advice if constipation is not resolved. In regard to the burps you are experiencing please ensure you try to: - Eat smaller frequent meals - Peppermint capsules/tea for sulphur burps - Stay well hydrated  - Ensuring to remain physically active and incorporating exercise into routine. Please note your next prescription of 3 pens has been issued and your annual review with be at the end of April or early May 2025  as you started Wegovy on the 16/5/2024.  Kind regards  Keisha Chauhan  Specialist Weight Management Service Dietitian 
1/15/25 13:22: Wegovy Feedback meeting 15.1.25 Feedback- would like access to chemist4u to decide on delivery dates as can deliver during inconvenient times or when not available or at home to be able to sign for delivery. Dose: 2.4mg dose Duration: 9 months on medication.  Benefits: Lowered Hba1c- 36mmol/mol Recognises when feels full on medication Reduced alcohol intake to 0-6 units per week from 14 units per week (weekends and social events) usually wine or spirits  x2 gin and tonic and glass of wine on Saturday. Reduced socialising.  Feels well inself and confident she can succeed  Due to go away in February and will do bike riding while abroad  currently practising bike riding now. Barriers: Food noise is still present Constipation  Stayed at same weight since 6 month review – 115kg Eating at night- cheese and biscuits  ice cream or chocolate- x3-4 times per week  feels this has happened since December  since cold weather  feels she was previously able to say no but now struggles mentally. Recognises she has high expectations on Wegovy and feels disappointed as she may be reverting back to old habits  expectation to have no food noise. Feels weight loss is slow  sees articles or information on Wegovy on TV and compares as she has not lost as much weight. Discussed: - Habits - Lifestyle factors  Wegovy being part of support to lose weight but to consider other factors  sleep  diet  exercise  lifestyle as main influence.  - Smart goals around alcohol intake and establishing a healthy routine - Use of distractive techniques in evening to avoid late night snacking - Diabetic control – CBGs and alcohol intake and impact of food choices/mood. - Management of constipation- resources sent previously via email - Focus on positive aspects of change- recognising lapses  weight maintenance  lowered Hba1c  reduced alcohol intake - Continue reduction of alcohol intake  - Opt for x1 healthy snack in place of unhealthy snack 
1/17/25 14:23: 3 x 2.4mg issued

1/27/23 0:00: BB Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? I just wanted to confirm that you have been booked onto our 6pm virtual group starting on Tuesday 16th January. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

1/9/24 10:09: MLP/Conf email sent - Good Morning Welcome to MoreLife the Weight Management Service. Your group starts on Wednesday 17th January at 10am. The duration of the group is 1 hour and 30 mins and runs every Wednesday for 12 weeks. Please find the address of the venue below. Chalvedon Community Centre  1 Chalvedon Avenue  Basildon SS13 3QX The Morelife programme is a specialised weight loss service with limited places available and therefore we do highlight the importance of attending the sessions and your commitment to the programme. If for any reason you are unable to attend a session please do make our staff aware of this as soon as possible  or if you feel that this is not the right time to start your journey please do let us know so that we can offer your place to someone else. Your weight management practitioner is Darragh and he will be in contact to welcome you and answer any final questions you may have. Please note that this is the first phase of your programme and there will be 8 monthly sessions after. Darragh will give you more information about this nearer the time. Alongside your weekly sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the face to face sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. Finally  myself and the team at MoreLife would like to wish you the all the best on your weight loss journey.    Best Wishes

9/18/23 10:45: Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Claire Birtwistle Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? Yes Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? GP referral Health Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? I feel like I'm at a crossroad where if I carry on as I am  I will develop weight related health issues soon but if I make changes now I can prevent that from happening. I have 2 young children and I want to be here for them for as long as possible. Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Meal Replacement i.e. Slimfast Slimming groups i.e. Weight Watchers  Slimming World Reducing Portion Reducing carbohydrates Q6. Were you successful? Yes No Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Money Unsustainable programme Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines I feel like I have good knowledge and common sense and know I am able to lose weight in the short term but I need focus and help with staying committed in the long term. Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? None Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? No Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? N/A Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? No Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? None Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery No Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Q18. I am aware that COVID-19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID-19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID-19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a pre-existent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat Yes Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes

9/7/23 17:21: Engagement Questionnaire Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Sarah Arrow Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? Yes Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? GP referral Diagnosis of Diabetes Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? I've always wanted to lose weight. After the birth of my youngest daughter  my hormones went haywire  I developed PCOS and the weight wouldn't shift. I've done VLCD and I cycle daily. And in July I managed to lose 2lbs. Yup  5 miles a day cycling  3 x 20 minute walks  low carb diet  no snacking  no cholocate and for the entire month I've lost 2lbs. I asked the doctor for Ozempic. I have blood pressure through the roof  and I'm mortally obese with diabetes but they won't give it to me as I don't qualify. Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Meal Replacement i.e. Slimfast Slimming groups i.e. Weight Watchers  Slimming World Reducing Portion Monitoring calories Reducing carbohydrates Q6. Were you successful? No Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Other (please specify): Hormones are up the wall. Which is why I wanted to try Ozempic as I heard it helps balance the insulin etc. And if I had the money I'd buy it Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines Support Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? Diabestes High blood pressure Mortally obese Currently I have shin splints which means I can't cycle Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? Yes Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? N/A Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? Yes Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? Yes Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? I don't know about the mental health thing. I have too much to worry about with the diabetes and blood pressure to add mental health to the list. See 15 as well I don't know is also the answer to this. It might be an option I just don't know. I just don't want to die of a stroke or heart attack so I have to consider these options as well Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery Yes Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Q18. I am aware that COVID19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a preexistent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat Yes Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes

9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

11/2/23 14:09: missed session 6 - Hi Darragh   To be honest I’ve had a horrendous week since last Wednesday evening when I found my Mum passed away on her sofa completely unexpectedly. With everything that goes with that and many various friends and family coming round daily plus losing 4 days of not working on my end of month stuff my weight has increased by 5lb which has just added to my stress to be honest.  Yesterday for example I went to my office at 8.30am and got out at 4am this morning which was unavoidable and I’ve had 3hrs sleep feeling pretty stressed and now got calls coming in from the coroner and funeral directors this morning with a few things I need to do for them. I’ll be there at 1pm if I can but right now I think I’ll either be in the middle of sorting stuff out for my mum or asleep  Really Sorry   - - follow up - - -Hi Darragh Sorry I only just saw your reply. I am available if you would like a chat. I think I will be ok from next week but I've no idea at the moment about funeral dates etc.  I really don't want to just stop the sessions now I'm so far into it as I need to do it but being honest I'm just really struggling to apply what we are learning as I'm just so fed up with not being able to train and being in so much pain all the time.  I'm not sure what the answer is right now but I don't think stopping now is the answer.

1/31/23 0:00: BB Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Mental Health Support – Vita Minds IAPT Basildon Brentwood Billericay & Wickford - Vita (vitahealthgroup.co.uk) Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. We apologise for any inconvenience caused. Your health is important to us and that’s why we wanted to update you and offer you the chance to explore other services in the meantime. We look forward to welcoming you to our programme in the near future. A member of our team will be in touch in the next few weeks. Best wishes The MoreLife Team

DIPPLE MED CTR Dear Colleague RE: Billie SNAZELL D.O.B. 13.11.1978 NHS No: 426 467 8382 Thank you for referring your patient to MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management service. We are writing to inform you that this patient does not meet NICE eligibility for Saxenda and therefore will be added to the waiting list and contacted when more places become available from April 2023. The patient is eligible for the Tier 3 service however due to limited spaces until April 2023 MoreLife are only currently able to accept those patients who do meet NICE eligibility criteria for Saxenda. The patient will remain eligible for MoreLife’s Tier 3 service. Please reassure your patients that by joining any interim service they will still be eligible for the MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management service. 3/31/23 0:00: Interested in BE course. Have requested book and made aware of delay.
4/26/23 0:00: BE Sent
11/3/23 16:28: Contacted Billie on 3-11-2023  She confirmed she had received the book. Scheduled Introductory session for 10-11-23 at 4pm.
11/10/23 17:15: Had Introductory session today. Billie is motivated and really wants to make this change  the lack of an eating pattern and binge eating habits are affecting her health and mobility. We have arranged and appointment for session 1 on Friday the 17th at 4.30pm.
11/19/23 10:11: Had session 1 with Billie on Friday the 17th on November. She mentioned that she had forgotten to work on the book during the week and she had done just a few pages just the day of the session. She therefore had nothing she wanted to talk about. When I started asking her related questions she was not open to talk at all. We finished the session after only half an hour because she wasn't very willing to talk. 
11/26/23 9:45: I had an scheduled appointment with Billie on Friday the 24th Nov. She cancelled the appointment just before it started  she said she couldn't work on the activities in the lessons. I offered her the option of supportiing her with the activities during our session or otherwise pausing the programme until she felt more ready for it  She asked me to go through the activities together so we have rescheduled our appointment for Tuesday the 28th at 6pm.
11/29/23 8:47: I had session with Billie on Tuesday the 28th at 6pm. She said she was finding hard to complete the activities and follow the sessions. She mentioned she had suffered depression for many years and found it hard to cope.  She had spoken to her GP   who had suggested her to get in contact with MIND. She decided that that was the path she was going to follow and we agreed to pause her programme till further notice.

6/8/23 0:00: Dear colleague I reviewed Mr Giddings this morning again regarding his excessive weight and he is very concerned about his health going forward if he continues along this path. Mr Giddings is very keen to try to lose weight as he is already suffering significant issues due to him BMI of 62 (175kg). I understand that the strict criteria for referral to consider Saxenda requires a HbA1c between 42 and 47mmols would make Mr Giddings ineligible however I believe his circumstances are such that he really does need some form of intervention to help him lose weight from yourselves in the tier 3 weight management service anyway. His HbA1c in 2018 was 37 and has now risen to 40 which is trending towards pre-diabetes. Mr Giddings is also in renal failure with an eGFR of 7 and is undergoing thrice weekly dialysis as well as being treated with multiple agents for hypertension. I hope you can appreciate the Mr Giddings is not simply overweight but has significant health problems which I believe could be improved with substantive weight loss. If you cannot accept the referral for consideration of Saxenda I would implore you to please see this gentleman as a matter of urgency to offer him some other support with weight loss as his long term health prospects without appear very bleak. I have today requested repeat bloods to assist in your workup.

11/10/23 14:11: GP note on referral - I have been seeing this pleasant 45-year-old gentleman for some months regarding a number of issues  but most notably about his excessive weight and the need for substantial weight loss as rapidly as possible due to his other health conditions.  Mr Giddings is currently being treated for high blood pressure but is also in stage 5 renal failure requiring weekly haemodialysis and a renal transplant as soon as possible. Given Mr Giddings weight of 177kg  this type of surgery is currently ill advised. The renal transplant specialists have informed us that a weight of around 100kg or less would need to be reached in order to make him eligible for a renal transplant and ultimately for it to be successful.  Mr Giddings is working at reducing his weight slowly  but his exercise tolerance is very poor and he is somewhat stuck. I am very grateful that MoreLife has been willing to consider Mr Giddings for treatment with Saxenda  although I understand from Mr Giddings that new patients are not being commenced on this medication due to supply issues.  It is my understanding that Wegovy (Simaglutide) may be more available in the near future though. I would urge you to consider Mr Giddings as a clinically exceptional case as his current situation of renal failure requiring weekly haemodialysis  means that his life expectancy is very low. Without a renal transplant a patient in Mr Giddings situation would not be expected to live beyond 5-10 years. This is a devastating prospect for a 45 year old man  especially knowing that renal transplant would vastly increase this.  Even with Semaglutide treatment and substantial weight loss Mr Gidding's prospects are not great. This treatment would be a lifeline and I cannot emphasise enough how much Mr Giddings wants to grab this chance  have a shot at getting a renal transplant and living to a relatively reasonable age. Your consideration and compassion is greatly appreciated.  Many thanks. Yours faithfully Dr A Salmon

The team will be meeting on the 4th April to discuss Mr Giddings case  and we will let you know of the outcomes and the recommended treatment after this meeting.  Please feel free to get in touch if you have any further questions.
