5/24/24 10:09: Email sent to South Essex commissioner:  Hi Sarah    I hope you’re well.   We have recently received an urgent letter from a GP to request an assessment for their patient who is currently on our waiting list as a clinical exception  please find the background and recommendations from our clinical team for this patient below.    Age: 45 BMI: 62.7 Health Conditions:  Stage 5 renal failure requiring haemodialysis 3 times a week since June 2021. Unfit for transplant due to obesity. Weight loss target set. Essential hypertension Left brachiocephalic AVF Left ventricular failure Medication: Amilodipine Ramipril Haemodialysis at Southend Hospital Reason for clinical exception and individual funding request: Morbid obesity with multiple comorbidities. Unfit for renal transplant due to obesity. High cardiovascular risk due to ESRD and left ventricular failure with a cardiovascular event likely to cause significant dependency. Patient life expectancy is currently 2- 5 years without renal transplantation and medical intervention to reduce cardiovascular risk. In order to increase life expectancy and quality of life and reduce current comorbidities a renal transplant is necessary. The renal transplant specialists have assessed and recommended that a weight of around 100kg or less would need to be reached in order to make the patient eligible for a renal transplant and reduce the risk of intraoperative and post operative complications.   Our clinical team and Consultant endocrinologist have since provided this patient with an assessment and have confirmed that this patient is at very high mortality and morbidity risk and have recommended that this patient should be seen as a clinical exception for Tier 3 weight management. They believe the patient’s situation is exceptional. The benefits of weight management would produce not only a reduction in this patient’s comorbidities with related health benefits but they would gain more clinical benefit with regards to their renal treatment options and quality of life. The clinical’s team recommendation is that this patient should be prioritised and fast tracked on to the weight management programme with assessment for Wegovy to support weight loss. If 10-15% weight loss could be achieved it opens the potential for additional weight loss intervention and ultimately renal transplantation.   Due to the exceptional high risk of the patient and unique patient status. This patient has also been referred by their GP for specialist Endocrinology to enable face to face assessment and support at Southend Hospital. This would also ensure safe patient management and a multidisciplinary approach with their specialist renal Consultant if a weight management programme and obesity medication were to be initiated.  I just wanted to run this by you  based on the recommendations of our clinical team above and the client’s GP  can we start this client’s weight management journey asap and assess them for Wegovy? If you are agree for us to go ahead with this client’s treatment  are you happy for us to include this client in the 198 Wegovy funded places for 2024/2025 if eligible? I know the 198 Wegovy funded places hasn’t yet been signed off in our newest contract. Best wishes  Emily Costelloe

12/28/23 11:19: MLP/conf email sent - Good Morning It was a pleasure speaking with you. I just wanted to confirm that you have been booked onto our 1pm virtual group starting on Wednesday 10th January. Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria set be NICE guidance below unfortunately we can confirm that you do not meet all the criteria which means you are not eligible for this drug. • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia However you are still able to continue with our 12 month More Life programme and receive support from our qualified weight management practitioners to achieve your goal. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

9/4/23 12:50: sent a text to all clients saying that I was running their group and that I would be calling over the next 2 weeks. Also sent an email: Hello and welcome to MoreLife! As I’m sure you know  you’re booked on to a MoreLife weight loss group starting on Monday 11th September (Next Monday). I’m your practitioner and so I’ll be running that group for you. I just thought I’d email you all to introduce myself. Also  to give you some details on your group so that you know where you’re going. Here’s the group details: Date: Monday 11th September (and every Monday after up to 12 sessions) Time: 10am-11:30am Location: Socketts Heath Baptist Church  Premier Ave  Grays  RM16 2SB Here’s a google maps link: https://goo.gl/maps/pHkGZxyKSwPX1ZEH7 There is a small car park  but if it gets full there’s also on street parking around the area of the church. I’ll be calling everyone on the group either before  or soon after the first session  so I’ll be speaking to you all soon anyway  but if you need anything you can always call me on my number below. I look forward to meeting you all on Monday! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd 
9/8/23 14:43: Engagement Questionnaire Q1. What is your name? Please include first and surname. Terry Butcher Q2. Do you know what the MoreLife programme involves? Yes No Q3. What has led to you joining a MoreLife group? GP referral Health Q4. Why do you want to lose weight at this time? Feel better Q5. What methods have you tried in the past to lose weight? Exercise Meal Replacement i.e. Slimfast Slimming groups i.e. Weight Watchers  Slimming World Weight Loss Medication Monitoring calories Reducing carbohydrates Q6. Were you successful? Yes Q7. What was it that prevented it from being a long term solution? Change in circumstances Unsustainable programme Q8. What do you want to get out of the MoreLife programme? e.g. support  dietary guidelines Support Q9. Do you have any health conditions that you wish to make us aware of? High blood pressure Q10. Do you have Type 2 diabetes? No Q11. Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? N/A Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? No Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? No Response Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery No Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? No Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Q18. I am aware that COVID19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a preexistent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat Yes Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes
9/11/23 14:18: 08/09/23 - Engagement call. Called this client on the evening of 8th September. They answered. We went through their engagement questionnaire and I answered some questions about the programme. Then I sent a text showing the location of the Church ready for their first session.
9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd 
9/21/23 12:04: Sent the following email to the group: Hello everyone  I’m afraid that I have to postpone next week’s MoreLife session. As those who came to the session will be aware  I’m away on holiday next week. Cover for your session was arranged  however it’s now not possible to cover the session due to staff sickness. I’m very sorry to have to postpone your session. However  we will add an extra session to the end of your programme. You will still get all 12 sessions. Take care everyone and I’ll see you for your next session on 2nd October  Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

Some confusion around eligibility in the past. Pt has type 2 diabetes and has an uploaded document of retinal screening and recent HBA-1c. 
With this information pt is eligible and should be booked with a prescriber to complete OB 13.03.2025

responses.question: Wegovy Eligibility Factor
responses.answer:
Nice eligibility confirmed
Type 2 Diabetes

Medications
PMH: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, T2DM, Paraumbilical hernia, Gallbladder calculus (2012), Gout (1999)

Atorvastatin 20mg tablets ON
Bisoprolol 5mg tablets twice daily
Edoxaban 60mg tablets ON (for AF)
Flecainide 100mg tablets twice daily (for AF) for 3 weeks then stopping
Metformin 500mg tablets
Semaglutide 14mg tablets - Rybelsus - reports is on 3rd month of taking this will stop if eligible.
Over the counter: Vitamins d3 magnesium b12 coq10 probiotic vit E

Past medical history
Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, T2DM, Paraumbilical hernia operated all resolved, Gallbladder calculus (2012) all resolved. Measles - wears glasses
obesity

Confirmed no subsequent changes
Yes

Condra-indicated conditions check
None

Eligibility Confirmed
Yes

Diabetes

Patient understands responsibilty of diabetes team for diabetes medication management
Yes

Retinal Screening in last 12 months
Yes

HbA1c
55.0 mmol/mol

Pregnancy, Breastfeeding and Family Planning

Pregnancy and Contraceptive advice provided
Yes

Allergies
No

responses.answer:
8/24/23 9:33: Southend 6pm
12/15/23 12:34: Call from John to find out where he is on waiting list and when he can expect to be offered a programme - explained that unfortunately I am unable to offer this information - tried to point him in direction of Everyone Health in Southend or NHS app but he told that these do not work for him. Been advised by GP that he needs weight loss medication as he is 30st - Interested in weight loss medication
1/12/24 13:15: Call from John - he really needs programme - will do whatever it takes - his work know this is a priority for him due to his MH and physical health - changed from 6pm F2F to online 1pm
7/4/24 10:31: E.Q Sent 4.7 Online 4pm 
7/5/24 13:19: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes 
7/11/24 9:45: BP and Chol medicated awaitng bloods and PCS
7/12/24 11:08: Confirmation Email 10.7 and MLP
8/19/24 8:10: Hi Claire  I hope you are well. I have had my Blood Test and my Doctors should have the result. My Worry is that you did not get them sent to you. As when you sent this E-Mail to the I have to call them as I was told they said that they did not get ant E-mail so I forward this on to them why I was on the phone to them. That how I got the test done. Please let me know if you have all you need so we can look me getting the Injections for wight lost. Kind Regards John
8/30/24 9:01: Good morning John I've added you to the waiting list Assessments/prescriptions are starting Mid Sept through to March 2025. There are clients on the waiting list who started groups in January so waiting times will be much longer for July/Aug groups. Once I have a better idea of timeline I will let you know. Kindest regards Claire
9/13/24 12:54: I have tried to contact you to book in your Wegovy (weight loss medication) Assessment  I will try again please note call will come from 0161 number. Kind regards Claire@MoreLife.
9/16/24 9:17: Loving the sessions Very informative and educational Speaks very highly of Matt  even tho its group session feels very much 1-2-1 support. Has appreciated  my honestly and propt response to emails. Would like MoreLife to know that you are saving his life.
9/16/24 9:18: wegovu apps booked letter and leaflet sent
9/18/24 13:18: on scriptlink
9/19/24 10:17: weight uploaded 175kg
10/4/24 13:44: Good afternoon  Due to staff absence we have had to move your Wegovy assessment to:  10/10/24 @ 12.45  Please ensure your weight is sent prior to this appointment to avoid delay in prescription being made. (Boots or GP scales) MoreLife
10/10/24 14:54: Wegovy 0.25 mg x1 pen and sharps bin prescribed following Wegovy initial assessment. To take Wegovy 2.5 mg s/c a week for 4 weeks before dose titration  with review as planned.
10/30/24 8:50: Hi Claire  Sorry to bother you I had my appointment about my next delivery of Wegovy injection. As this Sunday is my last pen of the four at 0.25. Jus t a little worried. Kind Regards John NEXT prescription due out 5th Nov
11/5/24 8:46: wegovy 0.5mg prescribed 1 pen
11/18/24 9:05: Hi Claire Benson I am sorry I keep bothering you. But My once a week appointment has ended but I have not any E-Mail from More life about starting me Once a month meeting . Just a little worried. I have look for E-mail but other you can not find any other. Kind Regards John 
11/18/24 9:06: Morning John A questionnaire was sent to you on 13/11/24: Hello We hope you enjoyed the first 12 weeks of your programme; before you move onto the monthly sessions  please can we ask you to complete a questionnaire in the link below  at your earliest convenience. https://myclientgenius.com/s-url/8de09bea We thank you in advance for your time. Please contact us  if you require any help with completing this form  08000389050. Best wishes MoreLife Team
11/18/24 9:44: Hi Claire  Sadly must gone in to my Junk but have done the questionnaire and sent it back now.  Thank you for your support just so you know so far I have lost 2stone 8lb from the start of this program I know a long way to go but make me feel so supported which helps me feel energised and positive for the future Kind Regards John Sent from my iPad
11/26/24 7:37: wegovy 1mg prescribed
12/2/24 8:34: Good Morning Claire I have to start with a Big Thank you to your Team as from Starting this journal to lose weight I have lost 2st 9lb. And the injection are working. But The problem I have is Going to the toilet and Work in the Office. I work Three day at home and two in the office but know I am taking the Injection I am finding going to the toilet not regular and catch me some time unaware. Because my size this make problems for me and I have to use a Bum Gun or Bidet. This is not at work only at home. Can you help me with a letter I can give to work so until I am on the full amount of Injection and my body get into a routine. I can work from Home. Or should I talk to my Doctor on this matter I think it would only be to the end of January and My Body be all ok. Your Advice would be very happy. Kind Regards John - sent to RB and SB & ZA
12/3/24 13:38: Reply from RB reworded and sent to client: Hi Both    We have already sent out Wegovy -Confirmation letter to client and to their GP- we can resend that to client (if needed). And based on that confirmation- client should be able to request their registered GP to write to their workplace. If they have any issues getting it from GP- let us know & we will see what we could do further.   Dr Brennan- Do you agree with above?   BW Ranjana Babber
12/10/24 14:35: IMPORTANT: WEGOVY PRESCRIPTION Please be informed that we will be sending out your next due dose of Wegovy slightly early to avoid any delays due to Christmas/New Year (postal delay  staff leave  bank holiday). You will receive notification of this delivery by Pharmacy (Chemist4U). MoreLife (UK) Ltd.
12/13/24 13:11: 1.7 mg wegovy issued
1/22/25 11:34: 2.4 mg wegovy issued
2/3/25 14:19: 5 month review appt sent by text
2/17/25 11:46: 5 MONTH REVIEW CONDUCTED discussed with pt what is expected this programme To attend monthly sessions WILL HAVE 6 MONTH REVIEW TO CHECK 5% TARGE IS MET  pt consented to continue treatment 2.4mg issued
3/18/25 10:44: Called client to get consent for use of email- he gave it over the phone. 
3/19/25 10:15: email from OM (cc'd RB) - I’m in the process of informing all of the South Essex clients about the transfer to second nature.  This client is expecting a new prescription of Wegovy this week  will he still receive it okay or will he have to wait for Second Nature at this stage?   Fwd to ZA cc'd OM /RB
3/19/25 10:54: 1*2.4mg prescribed at 5 monthwegovy review instead of 2. Notified ZA for discrepancy and action pending prescription 1*2.4mg wegovy
3/19/25 13:51: 1 x 2.4mg issued 
3/19/25 14:10: Call to John to advise that his prescription has been raised - said he can't believe that we wont be supporting him  very happy with the support that he has received since the first call to now. We have changed his life around  truely lifesaving  he will miss us -and wishes us all well

9/8/23 13:47: sent following email: Hello and welcome to MoreLife! As I’m sure you know  you’re booked on to a MoreLife weight loss group starting on Monday 11th September (on Monday). I’m your practitioner and so I’ll be running that group for you. I just thought I’d email you all to introduce myself. Also  to give you some details on your group so that you know where you’re going. Here’s the group details: Date: Monday 11th September (and every Monday after up to 12 sessions) Time: 10am-11:30am Location: Socketts Heath Baptist Church  Premier Ave  Grays  RM16 2SB Here’s a google maps link: https://goo.gl/maps/pHkGZxyKSwPX1ZEH7 There is a small car park  but if it gets full there’s also on street parking around the area of the church. I’ll be calling everyone on the group either before  or soon after the first session  so I’ll be speaking to you all soon anyway  but if you need anything you can always call me on my number below. I look forward to meeting you all on Monday! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd 
9/11/23 14:18: 08/09/23 - Engagement call. Called this client on the evening of 8th September. They answered. We went through their engagement questionnaire and I answered some questions about the programme. Then I sent a text showing the location of the Church ready for their first session.
9/15/23 14:45: recap email sent to all clients: Hello  Please find information below on what was covered during session 1. If you missed the session it’ll help you catch up. If you were there  it’s just a handy recap. We want to firstly welcome you to MoreLife  we look forward to supporting you during this amazing journey. The sessions are designed to give you a greater understanding of how to manage your weight realistically and sustain long term weight loss. Our programme includes 12 weekly sessions which are 1 hour and a half duration along with 8 monthly follow up sessions lasting 1 hour.  We would like to direct you to your handbook to pages 1-19 are relevant to our first session (section 1: getting started) – I would encourage you to take some time to fill out page 8 – ‘why now’  think about/answer questions on pages 9-10 too. It may also be beneficial to make a note of your starting weight/measurements on page 12 and keep a record of your monitoring progress each week. Page 13 is about setting goals – have a think about if you have any long-term goals and make a note of these.  You’ll also set a weekly goal every week. But week 1’s goal is always the same – Keep a food diary! We recommend keeping a food diary throughout the programme to help maintain awareness  you can record a food diary in different ways (we discussed the various methods in our session: apps for example My Fitness Pal which is FREE to download  or My net diary  or (if you want a paid app) Nutracheck  phone notes  pictures  electronic/written diaries etc.) The format is far less important than the accuracy. Pick something you think is doable for you. I’ve attached some bits that may prove useful. If you’d like a food diary template one is attached. But you don’t have to use it. You can keep a food diary in whatever way works for you. I’ve also attached a sheet for you to record your goals week by week. You can use this if you like. Some people prefer to write their goals on their weight recording sheet. Again  whatever works. Lastly  you should have received a log in for an online platform called ‘mylifeplan’. This is our digital platform. I encourage you to log in to this. It’s got several videos and resources on there  and every week that you log in you unlock some new content. If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact with me via e-mail  call and text ?  My best wishes for a great week and I’ll see you all next week! Sarah Thorpe Delivery Lead – Essex Tel: 07990 044966 MoreLife (UK) Ltd

7/8/24 11:17: Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE

1/31/23 0:00: BB Client ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. 3/31/23 0:00: Saxenda -letter of interest emailed to client 31/03/2023 Dear Bradley We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

Saxenda has been evidenced to support individuals lose weight and reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease. In order to check their eligibility we need relevant blood results* dated within the last 12 months and current medication / diagnosis lists. • If this information is available then please send it as a PCS attachment to the above email address. • If they have not had the below tests in the last 12 months please could you arrange this with your patient and send us the results when available. Unfortunately without this information we are unable to assess eligibility and would not be able to prescribe Saxenda. *In particular we need: • HbA1c • Lipid Profile • Blood pressure • eGFR • Current medication • Current diagnosis list (surgical & medical) Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: 1 Recommendations | Liraglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

Our clinical team have screened you and you are eligible for our Wegovy pathway. however  to be a part of the pathway it is required to complete at least 6 out of 8 maintenance sessions.  So far you have only completed 2 sessions out of the 8 that were run for your group. However  we understand there was a lot of disruption to your sessions changing practitioner and changing dates so we’d like to apologise and offer you another group to catch up with in order to complete the required sessions.  Please see the available groups for you to join below. Please note these are online groups facilitated over Microsoft Teams  you will need to attend the next 4 sessions over the next 4 months to remain on the Wegovy pathway: - Tues 6pm - Wednesday 5pm - Thurs 11:30am  - Thurs 6pm  - Thurs 7pm - Friday 10am Please respond letting me know which slot works best for you. the sessions will be once per month as before. In the meantime we will be removing Helen from our waiting list we would ask you to re refer this patient back to us if required. 1 Year Outcomes First Session: 6th January 2020 – Weight: 207kg Final Session: 25th January 2021 – Weight: 196.6kg – 5% weight loss achieved. Number of weekly sessions attended – 11 out of 12 Number of monthly sessions attended – 9 out of 9 Thank you. Yours Sincerely MoreLife

7/8/24 9:49: Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE

3/30/23 0:00: Saxenda letter of interest emailed to client. 30/03/2023 Dear Lorraine We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

1/9/24 10:09: MLP/Conf email sent - Good Morning Welcome to MoreLife the Weight Management Service. Your group starts on Wednesday 17th January at 10am. The duration of the group is 1 hour and 30 mins and runs every Wednesday for 12 weeks. Please find the address of the venue below. Chalvedon Community Centre  1 Chalvedon Avenue  Basildon SS13 3QX The Morelife programme is a specialised weight loss service with limited places available and therefore we do highlight the importance of attending the sessions and your commitment to the programme. If for any reason you are unable to attend a session please do make our staff aware of this as soon as possible  or if you feel that this is not the right time to start your journey please do let us know so that we can offer your place to someone else. Your weight management practitioner is Darragh and he will be in contact to welcome you and answer any final questions you may have. Please note that this is the first phase of your programme and there will be 8 monthly sessions after. Darragh will give you more information about this nearer the time. Alongside your weekly sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the face to face sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. Finally  myself and the team at MoreLife would like to wish you the all the best on your weight loss journey.    Best Wishes

10/22/24 21:43: Call back to client regarding side effects from Wegovy  client requested call. Telephone call on 22/10/24 at 9am (30 minutes) Client on 2.4mg dose  reports no major side effects  recently had an eye test at opticians  results showed no concerns. Previously reported acid reflux  on lansoprazole  discussed dietary management for this. Discussed common and severe side effects and to reports if severe to team/A+E/GP and yellow card scheme. Reports she does not feel the medication is working effectively or finds it supresses appetite  and others in the group have had better progress than her  discussed importance of not comparing herself to others  as everyone is on a separate journey.  Client recognises that she could improve protein intake in diet  and not skip lunch meal regularly and work on incorporating more exercise into lifestyle. Discussed strength based exercises  has had 2 knee replacements and a/w an appointment for hydro physio treatment. She has found a local support group for those wanting to exercise after a knee replacement  but feels anxious to join due to how she will be perceived  discussion around this and how this is her own weight loss journey  and others will be in the same boat but also working on themselves. Keen to try make contact to start this. Has IBS  has constipation  reports going more frequently. Discussed dietary management for this. Confident with managing her diet and awareness of nutrition from ML sessions. Usually has a routine for BF in mornings  will opt for more variety and protein. Reports nil snacking and diet is low in fat. Attends slimming world to be weighed regularly and feels accountable. Discussion around habits and ways of making positive new habits and utilising habit tracker in handbook. Finds having different practitioners has not helped in sessions. Client aware evidence base suggests combination of exercise  peer support and engagement in service and diet will all contribute to weight loss results. Current weight: 97kg (reported weight- under 5% target) Plan: - To continue on 2.4mg dose. - Aim for regular meal pattern- not skipping lunch meal - Reduce caffeine to help aid reflux symptoms  increase water intake - Alternate injection site If tender on abdomen area  - Increase protein intake at lunch meal  - Recap over Habits session in handbook and on MLP (will email Matt B to send handbook to client again and MLP access) - Utilise group sessions  by asking group at start if theres anything she would like to spend 10-15 minutes covering i.e. smart goals  progress etc.. utilise time effectively by making it self guided if needed.

8/23/24 14:50: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

8/15/24 11:20: Hi Claire Thank you for letting me know I must admit and let you know how this news for me is devastating and makes my anxiety sore through the roof  I understand that there are other patients for you to get to but I have patiently waited over a year for this program and i cannot stress just how important this is for me I don't know if my GP made you aware but I'm going to make sure you know that this isn't just a weight loss journey for me it's also about my Spinal cord injury you see I'm currently on the pathway for a surgery that may change my whole life and the quality of life that I'm currently living or lack thereof. It's paramount that I lose some weight as soon as humanly possible for the surgeon to go ahead with the Spinal Cord Simulator Surgery I must bring my BMI down to 36 in order for the surgery to be safe and successful  this surgery will have a profound effect on my life and could eliminate up to 75% of the Chronic pain that I have had to live with since the assault in 2019  I am not asking for special treatment i Just want to have a better quality of life and part of the reason that my weight has increased is because of the medication Pregabilin I have had to take everyday for the severe nerve damage that has taken over the entire left side of my body sustained by my neck being broken in three places affecting the vertebrae's that control the hands  arms and legs  it affects my mobility and balance also. I really need this Wegovy Claire and I beg that you try to find a way to make an exception to get it for me so that I can have this Simulator surgery as soon as possible  please. Iv'e been working really hard to get my weight down less carbs and lots of protein this is why my weight has stabilized at 116 Kg and fluxsuates between 116 and 120 kg which is so frustrating when I'm putting the hard work to get it down and I actually thought that I had already been assessed for the Wegovy last year and told that I was a suitable candidate for it. Please again I beg and pray that you see if there is something you can do to hurry this process along and help me because this surgery is literally on hold until I bring my BMI down  I live and pray for the day where I no longer have to take this life altering medication anymore and can embark on a better quality of life. kindest regards Sarah Wahid.

1/31/23 0:00: BB Client Ltr - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Mental Health Support – Vita Minds IAPT Basildon Brentwood Billericay & Wickford - Vita (vitahealthgroup.co.uk) Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. We apologise for any inconvenience caused. Your health is important to us and that’s why we wanted to update you and offer you the chance to explore other services in the meantime. We look forward to welcoming you to our programme in the near future. A member of our team will be in touch in the next few weeks. Best wishes The MoreLife Team

3/30/23 0:00: Saxenda letter of interest emailed to client. 30/03/2023 Dear Mary We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

8/27/24 13:24: Wegovy email sent - Dear Client  Please read the information below carefully as it relates to our screening process to assess your eligibility for Wegovy (semaglutide). In order to check your eligibility  we need an up-to-date medical history and relevant blood results (please see further details below) dated within the last 12 months.   *In particular we need: •	Up to date medication list •	Up to date medical history (including surgical) •	eGFR •	Lipid profile •	Blood pressure •	HbA1c If you have not had the above tests in the last 12 months  please could you arrange these blood tests with your GP and please send us the results when available to claire.benson4@nhs.net If you have access to the NHS app then you should have access to this information directly  please send us your results to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Unfortunately  without this information we are unable to assess your eligibility for Wegovy. Please do send this information across as soon as possible to the following email address claire.benson4@nhs.net Please note that our team will be working as quickly as possible to screen you for Wegovy  however please be aware that the outcome of the screening may take some weeks after you have initially started your weight management programme. We thank you for your patience in advance. If you are eligible for Wegovy  we will firstly need to ensure you are committed to our weight management programme and therefore appointments will only be issued after 6 weeks of attendance. Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

1/25/23 0:00: BB Client letter sent by email - Dear Sir/Madam You have been referred by your healthcare professional to MoreLife Tier 3 Weight Management programme. We have had a huge amount of demand for the service in the past year and so unfortunately we currently have a longer waiting list than usual. The good news is that more places will become available from April 2023. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. We’ve included information about these other services below for you to look through. To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Mental Health Support – Vita Minds IAPT Basildon Brentwood Billericay & Wickford - Vita (vitahealthgroup.co.uk) Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. We apologise for any inconvenience caused. Your health is important to us and that’s why we wanted to update you and offer you the chance to explore other services in the meantime. We look forward to welcoming you to our programme in the near future. A member of our team will be in touch in the next few weeks. Best wishes The MoreLife Team

KINGSWOOD MEDICAL CENTRE Dear Colleague RE: Joanne FAINT D.O.B. 11.11.1967 NHS No: 432 157 4536 Thank you for referring your patient to MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management service. We are writing to inform you that this patient does not meet NICE eligibility for Saxenda and therefore will be added to the waiting list and contacted when more places become available from April 2023. The patient is eligible for the Tier 3 service however due to limited spaces until April 2023 MoreLife are only currently able to accept those patients who do meet NICE eligibility criteria for Saxenda. 12/29/23 9:56: MLP/conf email sent - Good Morning It was a pleasure speaking with you. I just wanted to confirm that you have been booked onto our pm virtual group starting on Thursday 11th January. Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

Your attendance throughout the weight management programme is essential to the start and your continuation of the Wegovy treatment.  You will be notified by the team via email on your eligibility for Wegovy.  Please use the following link for current guidance on this medication: Overview | Semaglutide for managing overweight and obesity | Guidance | NICE Best wishes

Copy of not eligible letter emailed to client. 10/01/2023 Dear Clare We are contacting you to inform you that More Life has now completed the internal screening process to find out if you are eligible for a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) which is now available to clients living in the South Essex area that meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria set be NICE guidance below unfortunately we can confirm that you do not meet all the criteria which means you are not eligible for this drug. • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia You are still able to continue with the More Life programme and receive support from our qualified weight management practitioners to achieve your goal. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes

3/5/25 16:41: Email sent back to client regarding updated EER / Kcal targets: Hello  Please see below for the calorie targets we would recommend. Please let me know how you get on if you would like any more support with this.    •	Your energy requirements to maintain your current weight would be: 2579 kcals    •	To achieve a 1lb (0.5 kg) per week weight loss  you would need to reduce your energy intake by 600 kcal per day. The energy requirements to reach this target would be: 1979 kcals    •	To achieve a 2lb (1 kg) per week weight loss  the energy requirement would be: 1379 kcals *We do not recommend that you go below 1200kcal/day.    Why do MoreLife not recommended that I go below 1200 calories per day?  MoreLife does not recommend eating less than 1 200 calories per day for multiple reasons. As covered in our first nutrition session  our bodies - made up of muscles  bones  and organs (such as our heart and brain) - need energy and nutrients from the food we eat in order to keep us alive and feeling good.  The same way that a car needs fuel to keep it running smoothly  our bodies need calories to keep all its functions working correctly. If you do not give your body enough calories (fuel) you might experience low energy  dizziness  difficulty concentrating  headaches and extreme hunger.  Eating too few calories for a prolonged period can lead to malnutrition and vitamin and mineral deficiencies.  Finally  when losing weight  we want to make sure we are doing it as sustainably as possible. Restricting calories too much will cause hunger  making it harder to sustain for a long time  taking us back to the start of our journey.  Is it okay if I choose a calorie goal between the 1-2lb weight loss target?  Whether you decide to choose the goal of 1 lb per week weight loss or 2 lb is personal to you. You can also pick a target between the two values. Think about which goal is most realistic for you and therefore more sustainable.  Reducing calories too much may be difficult if your hunger levels increase. Therefore  it may be best that you first reduce your calories to the 1 lb weight loss target whilst you get used to reducing your calories  and once you feel comfortable and you have adjusted to your new calorie goal  you can reduce your calories further to the 2 lb target.   The only time we wouldn’t recommend aiming for a weight loss of 2 lb per week is if the calorie requirements to do this drop below our minimum daily calorie recommendation of 1200 calories.   For example  if your daily calorie target to lose 2 lb per week is 1000  we would recommend that you still go for our minimum recommendation of 1200.  Please find below an example video for 3 different calorie tracking apps that we’ve found to be the most useful for our clients on the programme. We’ve given you 3 to choose from  as you may find one is easier to use for yourself. •	MyFitnessPal - https://youtu.be/DKvMYuCOsEI?si=gZsmOVFNr7VcnwHN  •	Lose It - https://youtu.be/fKYgpivRlGM?si=UxqzrREWK9iIqDka •	Nutracheck - https://youtu.be/yse5QVgOrrI?si=_yKaddjDV43-BjYm Please note: Some videos will discussed tracking macros. To keep it simple  please focus on your overall caloric intake. Who do I need to contact if I have any nutrition-based questions?  Providing your question can be answer within the scope of this service  if you have any nutrition questions during your first 12-weeks  these should be sent to your Adult Weight Management Practitioner. In the monthly phase  please ask your Nutrition Support Practitioner. MoreLife will keep you on the waiting list and you will be one of the first to be offered a place when more are confirmed by South Essex ICB. In the meantime there are a number of other services that are freely available for you to join in your area. Rest assured you will still be able to join MoreLife’s Tier 3 Weight Management programme even if you decide to join another programme whilst waiting for a place to become available. 5/5/23 0:00: Saxenda - letter of Interest emailed to client 05/05/2023 Dear Sherry We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

12/29/23 13:47: MLP/conf email sent = Good afternoon It was a pleasure speaking with you. I just wanted to confirm that you have been booked onto our 6pm virtual group starting on Tuesday 16th January. Please allow up to an hour and a half for the session and sessions will be at the same day/time each week for 12 sessions. This is the first phase of your programme with us which will be followed by 8 monthly maintenance sessions. Darragh  will be your practitioner and he will contact you before the start of your group to introduce herself and explain the next steps. Alongside your Zoom sessions you will be given access to our digital programme ‘My Life Plan’ which will help compliment the live Zoom sessions with your practitioner each week. This digital programme will allow you to set up your own profile  access weekly videos  record your weight  set goals  access useful resources on wellbeing  physical activity  mental health and recipes. To enable you to receive the full benefits of our programme  we recommend attending all the Zoom sessions with your practitioner and watch the videos via ‘My Life Plan’ each week. Please do ask your practitioner if you have any questions.  The link to ‘My Life Plan’ programme will be sent to you shortly. This will come from the email address – noreply@more-life.co.uk. This may go into your junk mail or spam so please keep an eye out for it. During the Zoom sessions we recommend having cameras switched on to enable you to interact with your practitioner and the other participants  if you have any concerns with having your camera switched on during the group sessions  please do speak with your practitioner.  If you have any other questions or queries  please do not hesitate to contact either myself or your practitioner. Best wishes 
1/23/24 15:39: Hi Darragh  Thanks for todays session.  Just wanted to share a couple of things as I missed your call on Monday.  I am currently using wegoy 1mg prescribed privately. I have been taking this for a few months now. I have been calorie counting and I am in a good routine of tracking my food using nutracheck  I also weigh all of my food to ensure that the calories I'm consuming are as accurate as possible. I have been making good habits and my goal now is to focus on starting some exercise and incoperating good nutrition.  Wegoy has been life changing for me personally and has helped me to recognise all of the cycles and emotional eating I have been trapped in for most of my life.  Sadly  I am just not sure how much longer I will be able to sustain the cost and hope that the course will further help me to manage and work on the issues around my food addiction/habits. Just thought best to share this info with you..  Cheers  Shel

5/5/23 0:00: Saxenda - letter of interest emailed to client 05/05/2023 Dear Patricia We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

AEGIS MEDICAL CENTRE 568 WHITMORE WAY BASILDON ESSEX SS14 2ER Date: 20/06/2023 Dear Doctor Patient: Patricia Block D.O.B: 26/06/1961 Your patient has been referred to us for Adult Weight Management and has expressed an interest in Saxenda (Liraglutide). 7/11/23 0:00: Text client to ask when would be a good time to call to book first BED session.
7/14/23 0:00: Have booked introductory BED session for 19th July at 12:30
8/18/23 12:29: Introductory session from 19th of July. Client listed her values as her health  family  mental health and confidence as motivators to change. She said her triggers for bingeing are being on her own in the house and being bored. She also mentioned that she hides her binges from others and eats in secret.  She has long Covid  which she is having rehabilitation for  and also has mobility issues. 
8/18/23 12:39: First BED session 26th July Client was using a lot of negative language about themselves. They said they use food as a way to cope with stress  anxiety and loneliness. Client felt their eating problems began when they lost their mum age 18. Illness  long covid and fibromyalgia  have exacerbated weight gain. Client said their self belief  loneliness and boredom are things that may get in the way of change.  Throughout the session asked some gentle questions to challenge the negative thoughts and beliefs they had about themselves. 
8/18/23 12:44: Second BED Session 3rd August Client said their bingeing has been better and they haven't been eating in secret. Client said they have been  more mindful about what they are buying and what and how much they are eating. They have started to focus on some self care practices. Because of her long covid she has been advised to do tasks for an hour and take 20 minutes break. She wants to work towards more physical activity but the long covid makes this difficult. She is doing a rehab programme at the moment where she does 30 seconds activity and then 2 minutes rest and they repeat. Client said they are feeling good about the changes they have started to make. 
8/18/23 12:50: Session 3 BED 17th of August. Client seemed motivated and positive. They said they are recognising fullness signals at night time now  and aren’t eating after dinner. Client say they are proud of the progress they have made. They are now eating breakfast  and said they are feeling more in control.  Client said doing mindfulness activities  that she has learnt at the long covid rehabilitation clinic  has also helped her apply things from BED programme. 
9/14/23 14:23: Client said they found session 4 of the book really helpful  especially the mindfulness aspect. She said that this coincided with the mindfulness she is learning in her long covid occupational therapy sessions. She has cut her hours at work and said she feels this will help with eating. She said she has been binging less when she has been emotional  and instead is having a shower  resting or doing arts and crafts instead. She also said she is bulk making food  which has helped for the days when her illness’ flare up. She has identified that she would like to work on her self esteem more and is speaking to a psychologist about this. Session 5 on the 28th of September.  
9/28/23 14:33: Client said they had a couple of times where they over ate over the last few weeks - one time when they were craving a particular food  and the other time when they were tired. They said they acknowledged the binge  controlled it before it spiralled further  didn’t berate themselves for it  and ate normally the next day. They acknowledged their progress on this and felt proud. Client said they really liked session 5 and had reflections on their childhood and how this had impacted their eating. Client seemed very positive and said they have been making other changes  including seeing friends and doing activities. Final session booked for the 13th of October.  
10/13/23 13:51: Client said they are feeling a lot more relaxed and calm  since doing the programme and the course for long covid. They said they have been more observant as to when they want to binge and they have bingeing a lot less  and when they do  they don’t berate themselves like they used to  and they get back on track after. They said they have been trying different activities  including hobbies  to distract themselves from food and have been more mindful about their hunger and fullness cues. Client said they are eating smaller portion sizes. They said they are feeling proud of the changes they have made and their change in mind set. We discussed ways to deal with lapses. They are keen to start the standard AWM programme.

9/16/22 0:00: I am classified severely obese. I have auto immune hepatitis which I take immune supressant medication for daily. I have arthritis in my hips knees ankles and toes. I have obstructive sleep apnoea which I use a CPAP machine for nightly. I have previously done slimming clubs such as rosemary coneley and do well but when I stop focusing I gain back the weight and more besides. I struggle to focus if I have an unexpected stress come up in my life. I was offered bariatric surgery via Hamerton hospital and when through the process to the last stage but didn't proceed as it was higher risk due to my liver condition and medication.

To join you can either ask your GP for a referral or refer yourself directly by completing information at the links below. List of locally commissioned services in your area: ? Essex Wellbeing Service (MyWeightMatters) delivered by Provide – Essex Wellbeing Service ? Digital Weight Management Programme delivered by multiple providers – NHS England » The NHS Digital Weight Management Programme ? National Diabetes Prevention Programme (NDPP) – Healthier You delivered by Reed Wellbeing - Healthier You | Diabetes Prevention (reedwellbeing.com) ? Mental Health Support – Vita Minds IAPT Basildon Brentwood Billericay & Wickford - Vita (vitahealthgroup.co.uk) Brand new activity finder has launched a Find Your Active campaign. With loads of sessions uploaded to give you ideas on clubs organisations and groups to join. Find Your Active Activity Finder – Find Your Active Activity Finder - Active Essex. We apologise for any inconvenience caused. Your health is important to us and that’s why we wanted to update you and offer you the chance to explore other services in the meantime. We look forward to welcoming you to our programme in the near future. A member of our team will be in touch in the next few weeks. Best wishes The MoreLife Team
3/14/23 0:00: Saxenda- Letter of Interest emailed to client 14/03/2023 Dear Cheryl We are writing to inform you of a service update and will require your response to this email so please read the information carefully. We are now able to offer a medication called Saxenda (aka Liraglutide) to clients living in the South Essex area and meet the specific criteria outlined in NICE guidance. Saxenda is medication that is 97% similar to a natural hormone that is released in the body after eating which triggers areas in your brain and makes you feel less hungry. This medication comes in an injection form which is taken daily. To find out more about this medication use the following link www.saxenda.co.uk To be eligible for Saxenda you must meet all the following criteria: • Body mass index (BMI) at least 35 kg/m2 or BMI at least 32.5 kg/m2 for members of minority ethnic groups • A diagnosis of non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (aka “pre-diabetes” or “borderline diabetes”) • High risk of cardiovascular disease based on risk factors such as hypertension and dyslipidaemia If you are interested in this medication and think you match the eligibility criteria please respond to ranjana.babber@nhs.net within 10 days from receiving this email/letter. In your email response please outline your full name so we can find your client record. This is so we can contact your GP and request the relevant information to see if you are eligible. If we do not hear from you in 10 days we will presume you are not interested in which case you will continue with the More Life programme. Regards Ranjana Babber Weight Management Specialist Dietitian MoreLife (Ltd) UK

Do have you have enough support so that you are confident managing your blood sugar levels and medication? N/A Q12. Do you have concerns over your Mental Health? Yes Q13. We work very closely with mental health services within the local area  would you like your practitioner to discuss with you the mental health services that are available to you to gain further support with your mental health? No Q14. Please let us know of any other relevant conditions? Due to medication I do suffer with extreme tiredness Q15. Are you attending the programme in order to be considered for bariatric surgery No Q16. If you are taking part in an online Zoom session  do you have a set of scales to weigh yourself at home? Yes Q17. The places on the course are very limited and if you begin the programme and drop out you may not be offered another course. We want you to have the best experience possible. Bearing this in mind is this the right time for you to join a group? Are you able to commit to at least 10 out of the 12 weekly sessions? Yes Comments: I have waited a while to get on this programme and I intend to fully engage with it to achieve my goal Q18. I am aware that COVID-19 brings a number of both known and unknown risks. I have chosen to attend during the pandemic in the knowledge that there is still a risk of contracting the virus. I understand the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 has a long incubation period during which time carriers of the virus may not show symptoms yet still be highly infectious. I understand that some people may have the virus but will not necessarily show any symptoms. I understand it is impossible to determine who has the virus and I understand that I must assume that anyone  anywhere could be infected with COVID-19 or possibly infectious. I confirm that I am not currently suffering from any of the following symptoms of COVID-19 and I have not suffered from any of these symptoms in the last 10 days: • Fever (A temperature of 37.8? or above). • A new and persistent dry cough. • Muscle pains. • Headache. • Shortness of breath and breathing difficulties (That are not a pre-existent medical condition). • Severe pneumonia. • Loss of taste and/or smell. • Extreme fatigue. • Runny rose. • Sore throat No Q19. I can confirm that I have not been in close contact of anyone suffering with any of these symptoms in the last 10 days. Yes
